Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Great communication with Kayleigh who went outside as I was a bit confused if I was in the proper location. I appreciated the tea, lotion, and love lavender scented products. Space is small and compact, definitely more of a space to rest up on travels. I enjoyed the decor which is primarily why I chose this air bnb. The shower had piping hot water which I need and appreciated. The temperature drops and bed/pillows were comfy. The sunlight comes in so beautifully and lights up the room. I'm a sensitive sleeper and could hear feet shuffling, cabinets opening and closing, etc in the main part of the house. review_text:
Albuquerque Drivers Review: Be prepared. Holy moly! Let me start by saying New Mexico has some insane drivers. Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™s tons of fender benders daily being so fast and reckless. Driving in a packed car moving from Oregon to Texas was really scary with the sun setting where itâ€™s right in your eyes and an already limited view due to packed car. Iâ€™ve lived in LA, Arizona, the PNW, and never seen anything like this. Reminded me of being in a taxi in New York.
Airbnb Review: Small space thatâ€™s maximized very well. Aesthetically pleasing as there were a series of home decor/design moments throughout the space which makes it appealing. Good for 1 person or a couple. It felt small just me and my two cats. Mattress nice and soft. Donâ€™t drink bathroom sink water. I make chamomile tea at night and had to dump the water and use some I brought. The only note I would give is that the saw dust/mulch is easier to walk on than those rocks on the side path to the Airbnb unit for travelers who are likely lugging items. There were a couple times I was worried Iâ€™d roll my ankle. Also wheeled luggage would be easier to roll on the saw dust mulch than rocks plus it would also emphasize the path giving contrast to the main rocked area.

Loved the location and ease of this small guest suite! Kayleigh was a wonderful Airbnb host as she was very communicative leading up to and during the stay. The guest suite was immaculately clean and I appreciated the small touches such as being able to purchase NM special chocolates, cactus soap, NM print masks, etc.
One thing to note as a heads up is that I was able to hear sounds and thumps from the main house (3am and early AM), but Kayleigh did mention that the night of my stay was the exception because their new puppy was adjusting to their home that night. Another heads up is that the thermostat is located in the main house, so in order to change the temp, you can reach out to Kayleigh. It was a very toasty 69 degrees but they had a ceiling fan.

The room was lovely and you are given free range of the house (including the kitchen and spacious backyard/patio), which is very nice. The only thing I'd gotten confused about from the photos was thinking there was a private patio entrance - both rooms can only be accessed through the main house. The location is very quiet and peaceful, but it's best if you have car access because the neighborhood is a bit of a distance to any amenities and getting a ride share on the west side of ABQ can be challenging. Mary was a lovely and responsive host and her pets were extremely friendly as well!

review_text: I had such a great stay at Mary's place. Staying with her was like staying with a long-time friend. She greeted me in driveway on arrival and gave tour of the place while going over what I shall expect during my stay. Her amazing kitty cats also joined in for the tour. The room was equipped with comfy bed, tv, desk, chair, a couple fans for those hot summer days, though not needed as here home was perfect temperature and a mini fridge. The bathroom was superb as it included a jacuzzi tub as well. Her home was beautifully decorated throughout, including the backyard and patio. Mary is really a super host, whose hospitality goes above and beyond. The details of providing a mini coffee bar, setting aside a shelf in kitchen refrigerator for guests, and setting out little dishes of snacks and mini candies definitely did not go unnoticed. My favorite part of stay was the conversations Mary and I shared out on back patio. I highly recommend Mary's place if visiting New Mexico.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Casita Serena was a nice little adobe house behind the owners home in a very quiet neighborhood about 10 blocks west of downtown Albuquerque and an equal distance from Old Town. It is convenient to both the I-40 and I-25 freeways but the neighborhood is a collection of post WWII homes ranging from small to quite large. It was a pleasant area to walk in day or night time. Its a very comfortable home for the two of us with a roomy bedroom and nice living room eating area. It was like staying at a friends home, not like some places which are completely furnished with Ikea stuff. Nice oriental rugs on floors, comfortable, nice older furniture. A small kitchen and bathroom but more than adequate for our needs.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Be absolutely clear THIS IS NOT LACY'S PLACE. She has 40 plus other properties. The owners live a few metres away- met them spontaneously on departure. I have requested a full refund from Airbnb. The casita is gorgeous and was clean with interesting art/ location, plentiful hot water and a comfy bed BUT I did not appreciate hunting for the welcome book without success so looking online and finding it mostly out of date. Kitchen- food on crockery/no hand towel or tea towel or cloth to wipe surfaces. No info about what to recycle/ several pans need to be removed as the non stick surface is badly damaged. No tea and chipped mugs. No plugs for kitchen sinks. Bedroom- couldn't use main light as remote was missing/ box of dead cockroaches in cupboard- need clearing and dirty washing removing/ sheets incorrect size for bed. Terrible and inconsistent wifi. Bathroom- no hand towels or bath cleaner/cloth. Generic communication before and after visit. Initial responses to my concerns then nothing

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: All in all, we had a nice stay in the casita.. The location is excellent - it's in a lovely and coveted neighborhood in ABQ and was easily walkable to a variety of restaurants, coffee shops, and bars. The space itself was bright and quiet with some nice decorations. Lacy was very proactive with communication and on more than one occasion checked in to see how things were going. There were a few things, though, that didn't quite live up to the expectations I had based on the photos, description, and especially price (I'm from ABQ and have stayed in several airbnbs around town while visiting family). The biggest one was the bed - we stayed for a week and had a terrible time sleeping. I realize mattresses are a very subjective thing, but both my partner and I found the bed to be extremely firm (hard, really) and we tossed and turned on it every night. The photos make the space seem nicer and more polished, wherein reality things felt a little shabby. Overall, though, a good spot.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
Stayed for a few days during the Balloon Fiesta. It was about 15 minutes from the fiesta field, about 10 minutes from Old town & other sites. Nearby chain restaurants & grocery stores. Great location as far as getting around the city!
The house was clean, tidy, & without clutter. Located in a small neighborhood, we didn't see hardly anyone out and about - a few barking dogs at night, but inside the bedrooms it was quiet enough for sleeping. Mattresses & pillows were a bit flat/squishy & the bed frames were squeaky - but everything was clean.
Appreciated that the house came with the essentials (soaps, paper products, etc) along with water bottles and candy to greet us! It was nice to have access to the two stall garage to be able to park the cars. Would appreciate another couch or some chairs for additional seating in the living room. Serge was easy and quick to respond. Was accommodating to let us check in a bit early! Overall Serge's place worked out well and we'd stay there again.

This place is fantastic! I would definitely recommend staying here!
Serge and Karyna are wonderful hosts. The place was clean and smelled lovely when we arrived. They thoughtfully included a few snacks, a helpful handbook, and every single essential we needed for our stay. I'm talking laundry needs, dishwashing needs, cleaning needs, plenty of TP, and paper towels, plenty of shampoo, soap, conditioner, plenty of towels, hangers, blankets and pillows. Just...everything! It immediately put us at ease, feeling cared for and carefree!
Communication with Serge and Karyna was smooth and easy. Any issues or questions I had were immediately addressed and answered by the hosts.
The place is spacious and airy. I had no idea how much I enjoyed a roof window/skylight until I stayed here (don't worry - they aren't in the bedroom in case you like to sleep in a bit like me!). It filled the space with sunlight during the day which was so cozy. Each room was pleasantly decorated and plenty big. There was just 2 of us staying in this house during our trip, but it could very reasonably hold a small group without feeling like you are on top of one another.
10/10 would recommend.

review_text:
Best Airbnb stay ever! My wife and 21 year old son had the best stay here. So peaceful up in the Sandia mountains. The greatest views at all times of day and night. Secluded mountain home in a small neighborhood. Upscale amenities. Comfortable and peaceful. Ashlee and Janosnhave spared no expense. The patio was my favorite just being surrounded by the Sandia mountains (ancient home of the Sandia Indian tribe). Evening cocktails on the patio and morning coffee outside were just what the doctor ordered. We cooked six dinners and went out one night. Her local recommendations are spot on!
It felt like home and we fell in love with Albuquerque and New Mexico. This is the perfect base for exploring the region yet we were always eager to return to the house. We have sun, wind and snow all in our week here. Nature lovers will appreciate this majestic home in the mountains. And youâ€™re 20-25 minutes from everything you need in town.
We canâ€™t wait to come back and stay here and explore more!

Cabin is equipped w/ pet door that leads to a fully enclosed dog run, so no worries about pets running off or protection from wildlife. Would highly recommend to tourists and locals alike. Perfect, much needed getaway. Love that travel didnâ€™t eat up our time, but really felt like I was able to escape. Canâ€™t wait to return. Secretâ€™s out! We had a great time at Dan's placeâ€”what was particularly great about it is that it seemed like just about everything we wanted to do was super easy to get to. And parking at the place was a breezeâ€”there were several available parking spots, and we never had a problem.
There's a great little coffee shop just a few blocks away, and a Walgreen's across the street, and a local grocery store pretty nearby. Lots of great restaurants as well.
The space was lovely, and having access to the rooftop patio was a nice bonus: we watched a beautiful sunset there one night.
Dan was very supportive and responsive, and often would send little check-in messages unprompted throughout our stay, which we appreciated.
The value was incredibleâ€”most of the other places we were looking at wouldn't have been quite as conveniently located, and were a significant increase in price, so it was nice to be able to feel like we got fabulous value out of the place.
Thanks to Dan for being a great host.

review_text:
Cannot say enough good things about Kevin's guesthouse. This is one of the best airbnb homes we've stayed at. It was super comfortable and cozy.
Upon arrival, Kevin was very nice to greet us. The guesthouse was very clean with lots of teas, kcups and plenty of water bottles.
The living room does not have a TV, but it was perfectly fine as we had our phones and plenty of interesting books to read. I enjoyed browsing the books. I wished I had more time here so I could just sit and read.
The loved how there's so much natural light in the house. The half moon window in the living room allow a gorgeous view of the desert hills in the neighborhood. It was breath taking.
The memory foam mattress was very comfortable. My favorite part was the bedding. OMG. The genuine goosedown comforter and bed linens were so soft. It felt like I was snuggling on a cloud.
We appreciated the good quality bathroom products and unscented lotion.
So glad we stayed here instead of a hotel.

review_text:
Absolutely loved this place!
My husband and I drove over 8 hours and Kevin's place was perfect after the long drive! it was quiet at night and the bed was exactly what we needed. My husband was in an accident a few years back in which his L2 vertebrae was crushed and replaced with a titanium cage. He will forever have back pain, but the bed at Kevin's place is similar to the one we have at home and it helps lessen his back pain. There were also black-out curtains in the bedroom which was great because we are on the night shift schedule, and we didn't change our schedule for the trip, so we were able to get to sleep quickly.
The view from the living area is amazing! There is coffee and tea and a desk area for laptop and working. There is a great variety of books as well. If we were staying longer, we would've definitely been reading from their selection. Kevin and his wife were so kind to us and were prompt in answering any questions! We cannot wait to stay here again!

The best AirBnB we have ever stayed in - home and host.
We wish we could give more stars.
Beds, pillows, and furniture comfy. Hot tub and fire pit cozy. This beautiful home was easy to settle into. If you can peel away from the local New Mexican restaurants, you'll find the kitchen complete with anything you need to cook at this home away from home. Excellent wifi and office for remote work. Spacious for a family with teens to spread out. The home gets lots of beautiful light. If you're morning light sensitive, bring a sleep mask :)
An intangible - our teens are neuro-spicy (one ADHD & one Autistic). This home was GREAT for helping them feel at ease and met all their sensory/ comfort needs.
Trey was super helpful in finding food and entertainment. His Balloon Fiesta advice was sage. He always went the extra mile (including helping guide me to the best brewery and wrote a lovely note to welcome us). He even shipped our forgotten items to us!
Definitely a warm and kind host.

The location of the casita was perfect. Nestled in the beautiful village of Corrales, we were able to enjoy the tranquility and natural beauty of the area while still being within easy reach of Albuquerque. It was the perfect balance of peacefulness and convenience.
If you're looking for an authentic, cozy, and welcoming place to stay in Corrales while exploring Albuquerque, we highly recommend Leah's place. It's always a fantastic feeling to be greated by a very warm and welcoming host. A charming and homely atmosphere, made for a truly delightful experience. We would love to visit again in the future.

This space combines the best of a nice hotel with the comfort of home: High quality linens, towels, robes (!), bath products, a very well-stocked kitchen with great appliances, beautiful walking trails nearby and well positioned between the heart of ABQ and nearby Rio Rancho. It's even more lovely than the pictures and very fairly priced, if you're looking at this property just book it, you won't be sorry!

Leah's place is a fantastic spot when looking to stay in the Corrales/Rio Rancho area. The home was very comfortable and clean. You can tell that she has paid attention to the finer details to ensure a great stay for her guests. The beds are comfortable, towels are fluffy and soft, the living room is cozy and quiet. The home sits right next to the major road running through Corrales so there is regular traffic, but the home's walls are thick and do a great job of muting most of the road noise. Getting a solid night's rest was not an issue if you're a light sleeper like myself.
Overall, don't hesitate to stay here. Leah was communicative, the home is fantastic, and you're close to everything that you might need during your time in Corrales.

review_text:
Beautiful house, even better than in the photos. Great layout, bright. Has anything you may need. Good quality furniture, excellent mattress, sheets, towels and even bathrobes! The house is well insulated, warm. Kitchen is well stuffed as well. Knifes are sharp, pots and pans pleasure to cook in. Amazing fenced garden, best in the area. Our dogs loved it and so did we. Great location, very peaceful, right on the trail along Corrales. Close to many trails around Albuquerque. Good restaurants. Our only struggle was that it is not walkable, especially important if you are with dogs. The host does not advertise it as such, so itâ€™s not a complaint, just sharing in case important to someone reading this review. We could take our dogs in the morning onto the trail, but after sunset there wasnâ€™t anywhere to go as most of the streets are dead ends.
Many thanks to our wonderful hosts for being very receptive and accommodating.

review_text: The Bridge house was the perfect place to stay over the Thanksgiving holiday with our family and two dogs. Leah was easy to communicate with, responsive and extremely friendly. The house was extremely clean, spacious, had two extremely large private bedrooms and a great living area that was perfect for two couples. The whole house was well appointed with all the amenities you would need in the kitchen, including spices, oil for cooking, coffee, etc. and the bathroom also had all the essentials you might need, even an extra toothbrush if you happened to leave yours behind! The yard was completely perfect for our dogs to stretch their legs and it was close enough to walk them down the street to hike in the Bosque. This was by far one of the nicest, dog friendly places we have stayed and we hope to return in the future!

Stayed about a week
review_text:
I can't say enough good things about the Bridge House! Leah's thoughtful attention to detail is evident from the moment you walk in the door. The house is sparkling clean and has everything a traveler could need and more. From the beautiful furnishings and comfortable bedding to the lovely outdoor areas and kitchen - we enjoyed every minute! The Bridge House ranks among our top stays - we felt so cozy, relaxed, and at home - the house made our time in New Mexico even more special.
Communications with Leah were a piece of cake and she was always quick to respond.
Corrales is a perfect location if you want to be situated between Albuquerque and Santa Fe and prefer to stay out of touristy areas. The village is fantastic - terrific breweries, wineries, and restaurants are minutes away by car, the locals are extremely friendly and welcoming, and every convenience from Albertson's to Target is just up the road.
If you're considering it, do yourself a favor and book the Bridge House! You'll be happy that you did. I can't imagine more perfect spot for a couples, friends, or family getaway!

review_text: The Bridge House is one of those special places that adds so much to a vacation stay. I was fortunate enough to stay there for two nights while attending the magical 50th Albuquerque International Balloon Festival. The home has a wonderful history and is as charming and beautiful as can be, with antiques galore and gorgeous artwork throughout. The bed I slept in was extremely comfortable with high quality linens. There were snacks in the kitchen, along with a welcome note and gift awaiting my arrival. I had my small dog with me and she loved the fenced-in yard with lush green grass (a rarity in the Southwest)! Communication was prompt, helpful and friendly, you couldnâ€™t ask for better hosts! The property is well-located in beautiful Corrales, close to all that Albuquerque has to offer and plenty of its own special places to try. This is a rare find and I hope to return sometime soon.

review_text: I can't say enough good things about this beautiful Corrales home. Communication with the host was fantastic (prompt and responsive, including going above and beyond to help me navigate some wifi hiccups on arrival that were no fault of theirs). The home is beautiful, spacious, comfortable, and set up like a five star hotel. The bath towels and bed linens were marvelous, the beds and sofa were very comfortable, and the whole home is filled with thoughtful decor and wonderful little southwest touches. The location is perfect for exploring Corrales and hopping into ABQ, and our two small pups had a marvelous time lounging on the patio and chasing the occasional bunny. The only disappointment was having to leave! We truly hope we have the opportunity to stay here again, and highly recommend this gorgeous home.

review_text: This is an adorable old-style authentically New Mexican adobe house. My family and I loved staying here. The host, Leah, had great communication leading up to the trip and during our stay. The added detail of snacks in the kitchen and a few toiletries in the bathroom were a really nice touch. The beds were super comfortable and the sheets were like butter. The house is very comfortable, clean and beautiful. Loved the decor. The location was close enough to Albuquerque, yet felt like you were a bit more out in the country. You could see donkeys across the street and vineyards. My family and I also appreciated reading through the house manual which detailed places to eat as well as the interesting history of the house and the city of Corrales. I would highly recommend this place to anyone! My family and I plan to stay here again the next time we come to visit our relatives in Albuquerque.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The host(s) are all kind, cooperative and willing to answer questions. Their location is safe, secure and restful. I'll definitely look to them again in the future.
The instructions are a bit verbose. As a semi-professional writer, there's a lot of "please read" followed by "also really important". I can't even be mad, though because anyone who doesn't want to sift through all of that can simply message them directly and they'll take care of you promptly!
I'm glad I stayed here and give full credit to the host/co-hosts for not just "getting me through" my visit but making it convenient, efficient and positive.
Thank you.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Great, cost efficient stay at this gated community right next to the Sunport Airport. It's listed as a microhotel, which is a great way to describe it. It's a mix between a hotel and a hostel. Each unit has multiple rooms with their own key code locks on the door handle to enter. You also need a key code to get into the community and into the unit itself. There are a lot of shared community items in the kitchen and free coffee. It was fairly clean, although a bit of clutter in the kitchen given that many guests seem to leave behind a lot of food without marking it as sharable and forget to do their dishes. I would suggest a once a month deep clean just to clear it and to get some of the harder to reach parts in the house/rooms. Can't beat this for the price though.

name: Corey
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
July 2023
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The good:
This host is very quick to respond. Place was really clean. The Bathroom has been upgraded.
The neighborhood is nice. No loud parties or music at night. I felt safe here.
There is porch seating overlooking the street, which was nice in the evening.
There is an electric tea kettle, a keurig, mugs, spoons, and coffee/tea provided by the host.
The neutral:
"Filtered water" means a pitcher filter in the fridge. You refill it from the bathtub.
You can hear the host and her dog through the doors and walls.
If you are using the sofa as a bed, there is not much seating.
The bad:
The electrical outlets all are worn, so its impossible to charge a device here. Plus, there is the safety issue of worn outlets sparking.
One window in the living room has only a sheer curtain on it (faces windows of host home and neighbor), and the front window has semi-sheers. No shades/blinds under either one. Felt really weird at night, especially for sleeping in the living room.

review_text:
Meg's place is the front section of their home. There is a large living room with TV and a comfy couch as well as a refrigerator where Meg provides drinks of various types. A curtain divides the AirBnB section from their living quarters. in addition to the living room, you have access to a private full bathroom and a large bedroom. The neighborhood is quiet. Restaurants on Central Avenue are about 10 blocks away.
Meg has a dog, Truffles. Truffles if very laid back and friendly and sleeps a lot.
Overall I had a good stay at Meg's place. I didn't meet Meg but spoke briefly with her partner. It's a fine place to stay on a business trip to Albuquerque.

On the bright side, Meg and Volk were very responsive to texts and Volk was very personable and helpful when we met him. They kindly left the porch and living room lights on the second night, left us filtered water and glasses, and had refreshments on offer. Their dog was also very sweet.
